page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.comment: Repairing 2 and tagging 1 external links using [[w:WP:CHECKLINKS|Checklinks]]
rev.diff:
Line 22: Line 22:
At the Israeli Embassy in Cairo on 15 May, [[2011 Nakba Day|thousands gathered for a demonstration]] but were dispersed by Egyptian security forces and the Egyptian army police forces using tear gas and live fire.<ref name="Bikya">{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=33601 |title=Army fires on Cairoâs Nakba rally |publisher=Bikyamasr.com |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Some 353 protesters were injured and 180 arrested.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/440439 Rights organization urges release of Nakba protesters]. ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''. 17 May 2011.</ref> At least two of the wounded had been shot in head and chest by Egyptian forces, and at least two of those arrested (''Mosa'ab Elshamy'' and ''Tarek Shalaby'') were well known for their [[Twitter]]s during the [[2011 Egyptian revolution]].<ref name=Bikya/> All those who were arrested faced military trials and were later freed.
At the Israeli Embassy in Cairo on 15 May, [[2011 Nakba Day|thousands gathered for a demonstration]] but were dispersed by Egyptian security forces and the Egyptian army police forces using tear gas and live fire.<ref name="Bikya">{{cite web|url=http://bikyamasr.com/wordpress/?p=33601 |title=Army fires on Cairoâs Nakba rally |publisher=Bikyamasr.com |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Some 353 protesters were injured and 180 arrested.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/440439 Rights organization urges release of Nakba protesters]. ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]''. 17 May 2011.</ref> At least two of the wounded had been shot in head and chest by Egyptian forces, and at least two of those arrested (''Mosa'ab Elshamy'' and ''Tarek Shalaby'') were well known for their [[Twitter]]s during the [[2011 Egyptian revolution]].<ref name=Bikya/> All those who were arrested faced military trials and were later freed.
â
Five thousand six hundred civilians were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Amnesty: Egypt still abusing human rights |first=Ben |last=Hubbard |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5ivQ098Va2atm7LVdxwta2mijygrg?docId=7f00d7e8d47a49c3976739edf72f5251 |publisher=Google.com |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>
+
Five thousand six hundred civilians were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>http://www.foxnews.com/world/2011/05/18/amnesty-egypt-abusing-human-rights/</ref>
==Murder==
==Murder==
â
Ramy Fakhry<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-25}}</ref>, 27-year-old electrical engineer, was killed by the army.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/12289/Egypt/Politics-/Candlelight-vigil-for-Egyptian-shot-by-army-asks-W.aspx |title=Candlelight vigil for Egyptian shot by army asks 'Why was Ramy killed?' |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> He died as a result of bullet wounds received at an army checkpoint somewhere in the governorate of Damietta. The checkpointâs exact location is unknown.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/crime-a-accidents/family-of-man-killed-at-checkpoint-demands-investigation.html |title=Family of man killed at checkpoint demands investigation |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-15 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> According to one, unconfirmed, version of events, Fakhry stopped his car just short of the checkpoint when he saw a gunfight between the army and assailants ahead of him and was shot three times in the back as he attempted to drive away.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/crime-a-accidents/family-of-man-killed-at-checkpoint-demands-investigation.html |title=Family of man killed at checkpoint demands investigation |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-15 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> Another version of the story says he left the rig where he worked near Damietta on Friday 13 May to attend a wedding. On his way back later that night at 1am â before the curfew imposed at the time â Fakhry was shot dead at an army checkpoint.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death|publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> A candlelight vigil was organized by Ramy's family and friends on May 14th, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arabawy.org/2011/05/17/tribute-to-ramy-fakhry-%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%8A-%D9%81%D8%AE%D8%B1%D9%8A/ |title=Tribute to Ramy Fakhry 3|publisher=www.arabawy.org|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> Head of the Supreme Council for Armed Force (SCAF), Field Marshal Hussein Tantawi, ordered an investigation into the killing of Ramy Fakhry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/people/following-vigil-scaf-orders-investigation-into-army-shooting-of-engineer.html |title=Following vigil, SCAF orders investigation into army shooting of engineer |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> The statement has not been followed with any updates concerning the investigation, prompting the call for action.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death|publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref>
+
Ramy Fakhry,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-25}}</ref> 27-year-old electrical engineer, was killed by the army.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/12289/Egypt/Politics-/Candlelight-vigil-for-Egyptian-shot-by-army-asks-W.aspx |title=Candlelight vigil for Egyptian shot by army asks 'Why was Ramy killed?' |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> He died as a result of bullet wounds received at an army checkpoint somewhere in the governorate of Damietta. The checkpointâs exact location is unknown.<ref name="thedailynewsegypt1">{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/crime-a-accidents/family-of-man-killed-at-checkpoint-demands-investigation.html |title=Family of man killed at checkpoint demands investigation |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-15 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> According to one, unconfirmed, version of events, Fakhry stopped his car just short of the checkpoint when he saw a gunfight between the army and assailants ahead of him and was shot three times in the back as he attempted to drive away.<ref name="thedailynewsegypt1"/> Another version of the story says he left the rig where he worked near Damietta on Friday 13 May to attend a wedding. On his way back later that night at 1am â before the curfew imposed at the time â Fakhry was shot dead at an army checkpoint.<ref name="ahram2">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/14715/Egypt/Politics-/Activists-and-friends-seek-answers-over-Ramy-Fakhr.aspx |title=Activists and friends seek answers over Ramy Fakhryâs death|publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> A candlelight vigil was organized by Ramy's family and friends on May 14th, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arabawy.org/2011/05/17/tribute-to-ramy-fakhry-%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%8A-%D9%81%D8%AE%D8%B1%D9%8A/ |title=Tribute to Ramy Fakhry 3|publisher=www.arabawy.org|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> Head of the Supreme Council for Armed Force (SCAF), Field Marshal Hussein Tantawi, ordered an investigation into the killing of Ramy Fakhry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailynewsegypt.com/people/following-vigil-scaf-orders-investigation-into-army-shooting-of-engineer.html |title=Following vigil, SCAF orders investigation into army shooting of engineer |publisher=www.thedailynewsegypt.com|date=2011-05-17 |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref> The statement has not been followed with any updates concerning the investigation, prompting the call for action.<ref name="ahram2"/>
==Censorship==
==Censorship==
Line 43: Line 43:
==Virginity testing==
==Virginity testing==
â
Since the overthrow of Mubarak there have been widespread reports of detained Egyptian women having their "virginity checked" by a male officer or doctor. Numerous journalists and released prisoners and protesters have confirmed the practice, which Egyptian officers said was to evaluate whether or not they had been raped.<ref>{{cite web|last=Leyne |first=Jon |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13796966 |title=BBC News - Egypt's defiant women fear being cast aside |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=June 2, 2011 |  9:32 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/babylonbeyond/2011/06/egypt-victim-details-virginity-test-denies-military-claims.html |title=EGYPT: Woman denies military's claims about 'virginity test' - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/may/31/briefing-page-mideast/ |title=Briefly: Mideast |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-05-31 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0601/Virginity-tests-Misogyny-and-intimidation-in-Egypt |title=Virginity tests: Misogyny and intimidation in Egypt |publisher=CSMonitor.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NuR8gIYMEY8 |title=âªEgyptian army denies 'virginity tests'â¬â |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,767365,00.html |title='Horribly Humiliating': Egyptian Woman Tells of 'Virginity Tests' - SPIEGEL ONLINE - News - International |publisher=Spiegel.de |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> The Egyptian military initially denied any virginity checks taking place<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/video/middleeast/2011/06/20116255012877754.html |title=Egyptian army denies 'virginity tests' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> and then asserted the practice would not continue in the future.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20110607/wl_africa_afp/egyptpoliticsunrestrights_20110607172638 |title=Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW - Yahoo! News |publisher=News.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=(AFP) – Jun 7, 2011 |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5h1oml-bY_PJl5W9cPJtbpdUY_y-Q?docId=CNG.fafcacea0287fbeab90256732f165e1e.3a1 |title=AFP: Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW |publisher=Google.com |date=2011-06-07 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> News of the virginity tests sparked a public outcry from [[Amnesty International]] and [[Human Rights Watch]] as well as local Egyptian activists, [[Mona Seif]] for example, and citizens in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-20067419-503543.html |title=Report: Egypt admits to forcing "virginity tests" - World Watch |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10729592 |title=Egyptian activists voice outrage at 'virginity tests' - World - NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.cfr.org/coleman/2011/06/03/what-do-egyptians-say-about-the-militarys-virginity-testing/ |title=Isobel Coleman: Democracy in Development Â» Blog Archive Â» What Do Egyptians Say about the Militaryâs âVirginity Testingâ? |publisher=Blogs.cfr.org |date=2011-06-03 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mackey |first=Robert |url=http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/06/01/egyptian-bloggers-press-army-on-abuses-during-interim-rule/ |title=Egyptian Bloggers Press Army on Abuses During Interim Rule - NYTimes.com |location=Egypt |publisher=Thelede.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Protesters have seen the tests as evidence that more reform is needed and that the rule under SCAF is not stable or trustworthy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/worldwide/middle-east/disillusion-starts-to-grow-with-egypts-military-amid-fears-of-mini-mubaraks |title=Disillusion starts to grow with Egypt's military amid fears of 'mini-Mubaraks - The National |publisher=Thenational.ae |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/466660 |title=Human Rights Watch: The Egyptian revolution is not over | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2010-01-24 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref>
+
Since the overthrow of Mubarak there have been widespread reports of detained Egyptian women having their "virginity checked" by a male officer or doctor. Numerous journalists and released prisoners and protesters have confirmed the practice, which Egyptian officers said was to evaluate whether or not they had been raped.<ref>{{cite web|last=Leyne |first=Jon |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13796966 |title=BBC News - Egypt's defiant women fear being cast aside |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=June 2, 2011 |  9:32 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/babylonbeyond/2011/06/egypt-victim-details-virginity-test-denies-military-claims.html |title=EGYPT: Woman denies military's claims about 'virginity test' - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/may/31/briefing-page-mideast/ |title=Briefly: Mideast |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-05-31 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0601/Virginity-tests-Misogyny-and-intimidation-in-Egypt |title=Virginity tests: Misogyny and intimidation in Egypt |publisher=CSMonitor.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NuR8gIYMEY8 |title=âªEgyptian army denies 'virginity tests'â¬â |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,767365,00.html |title='Horribly Humiliating': Egyptian Woman Tells of 'Virginity Tests' - SPIEGEL ONLINE - News - International |publisher=Spiegel.de |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> The Egyptian military initially denied any virginity checks taking place<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/video/middleeast/2011/06/20116255012877754.html |title=Egyptian army denies 'virginity tests' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> and then asserted the practice would not continue in the future.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://old.news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20110607/wl_africa_afp/egyptpoliticsunrestrights_20110607172638 |title=Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW - Yahoo! News |publisher=News.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=(AFP) – Jun 7, 2011 |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5h1oml-bY_PJl5W9cPJtbpdUY_y-Q?docId=CNG.fafcacea0287fbeab90256732f165e1e.3a1 |title=AFP: Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW |publisher=Google.com |date=2011-06-07 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> News of the virginity tests sparked a public outcry from [[Amnesty International]] and [[Human Rights Watch]] as well as local Egyptian activists, [[Mona Seif]] for example, and citizens in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-20067419-503543.html |title=Report: Egypt admits to forcing "virginity tests" - World Watch |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10729592 |title=Egyptian activists voice outrage at 'virginity tests' - World - NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.cfr.org/coleman/2011/06/03/what-do-egyptians-say-about-the-militarys-virginity-testing/ |title=Isobel Coleman: Democracy in Development Â» Blog Archive Â» What Do Egyptians Say about the Militaryâs âVirginity Testingâ? |publisher=Blogs.cfr.org |date=2011-06-03 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mackey |first=Robert |url=http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/06/01/egyptian-bloggers-press-army-on-abuses-during-interim-rule/ |title=Egyptian Bloggers Press Army on Abuses During Interim Rule - NYTimes.com |location=Egypt |publisher=Thelede.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Protesters have seen the tests as evidence that more reform is needed and that the rule under SCAF is not stable or trustworthy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/worldwide/middle-east/disillusion-starts-to-grow-with-egypts-military-amid-fears-of-mini-mubaraks?pageCount=0 |title=Disillusion starts to grow with Egypt's military amid fears of 'mini-Mubaraks - The National |publisher=Thenational.ae |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/466660 |title=Human Rights Watch: The Egyptian revolution is not over | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2010-01-24 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref>
